alert.note: Alert for South and East Jackson, Larimer, North and Northeast Grand, Northwest Boulder Counties Above 9000 Feet; South and Southeast Grand, West Central and Southwest Boulder, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Summit, North and West Park Counties Above 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued December 20 at 2:59PM MST until December 23 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: .A strong arctic airmass brings well-below normal temperatures to northeastern Colorado Wednesday evening through Friday. In combination with strong winds, this will bring dangerous wind chill. Snow will accompany the passing system Wednesday evening through early Thursday for the mountains and plains with localized higher amounts for portions of the higher mountains. 6-9 PM Wednesday will feature the best chances for moderate snowfall rates over parts of the plains. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON WEDNESDAY TO 6 AM MST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM WEDNESDAY TO 11 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 50 below zero. * WHERE...Rocky Mountain National Park and the Medicine Bow Range, and The Mountains of Summit County, the Mosquito Range, and the Indian Peaks. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from Noon Wednesday to 6 AM MST Thursday. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 8 PM Wednesday to 11 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday evening and Thursday morning commutes. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. Exposed skin may become quickly frostbitten or frozen. Wind chill values may fall to extremely dangerous levels.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org. The combination of wind and cold temperatures will create dangerously low wind chill values. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
